rinse.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to wash clothes, dishes, vegetables etc quickly with water, especially running water, and without soap
rinse.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Let me just rinse my hands.
Rinse the vegetables under a cold tap.

rinse.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to remove soap, dirt etc from something by washing it quickly with water
rinse.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Leave the shampoo for two minutes, then rinse it off with warm water.
I rinsed the mud out under the tap.
rinse.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to put colour into your hair
rinse.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if you rinse your mouth, or rinse your mouth out, you wash it by filling it with water and then spitting (spit) the water out
rinse.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: I gave my hands a quick rinse.
rinse.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a product you use to change the colour of your hair or to make it more shiny
rinse.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: a blue rinse for grey hair
